latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 250 - 172 (Roll no. 231). (text: CR H2338-2339)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 250 - 172 (Roll no. 231).(text: CR H2338-2339)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 266 - 158 (Roll no. 230). (consideration: CR H2348-2349; text: CR H2348)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 203.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2338-2350)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 26.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. The bill shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. All points of order againist the committee amendment
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-54, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-54, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 910) to amend the Clean Air Act to prohibit to Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating any regulation concerning, taking action relating to, or taking into consideration the emission of a greenhouse gas to address climate change.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 910) to amend the Clean Air Act to prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating any regulation concerning, taking action relating to, or taking into consideration the emission of a greenhouse gas to address climate change, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 910) to amend the Clean Air Act to prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating any regulation concerning, taking action relating to, or taking into consideration the emission of a greenhouse gas to address climate change, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 910) to amend the Clean Air Act to prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating any regulation concerning, taking action relating to, or taking into consideration the emission of a greenhouse gas to address climate change, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
